intro: Anothea, commonly known as the blue mistflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is characterized by its showy, clustered inflorescences that resemble mist or clouds, giving it its common name. The plants are native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, including parts of Central and South America. Anothea species typically have simple, alternate leaves and produce small, inconspicuous flowers surrounded by colorful bracts. They are often cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
